vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἐγγίζω,
aorist ἤγγισα [Refs 4th c.BC+]: perfect ἤγγικα [LXX+NT]: (ἐγγύς):—bring near, bring up to, τῇ γῇ τὰς ναῦς [LXX+2nd c.BC+]
__II mostly intransitive, approach, [LXX+4th c.BC+]; εἰς θάνατον[LXX]; ἕως[LXX+NT]; to be imminent, ἤγγικεν ἡ παρουσία τοῦ Κυρίου [NT]: also, with genitive, approximate to, [Refs 1st c.BC+]
__II.2 to be next of kin, [LXX]
__III with infinitive, to be on the point of doing, ναοῦ -οντος συμπεσεῖν [Refs]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
come near, draw near
primarily to cause to approach; in NT intransitive to approach, draw near, Mt. 21:1; Lk. 18:35; metaphorically to be at hand, Mt. 3:2; 4:17; μέχρι θανάτου ἐγγιζειν, to be at the point of death, Phil. 2:30; from Hebrew to draw near to God, to offer Him reverence and worship, Mt. 15:8; Heb. 7:19; Jas. 4:8; used of God, to draw near to men, assist them, bestow favors on them, Jas. 4:8
vocabInfos._es_Definition: aproximarse a, venir o acercarse a
